intro: Haumaniastrum nyassicum, commonly known as the Nyassian thistle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native environment.
